location.address: Kozhikode Beach, Beach Road, Kozhikode, Kerala, India

images.caption: Walkway and old pier remains at Kozhikode Beach

history.short_description: Historic coastal hub of Kozhikode, once a major port for the spice trade and now a popular sunset beach.
history.detailed: Kozhikode Beach, located along the Arabian Sea, was historically part of the bustling port where Arab, Chinese, and European traders arrived for Kerala's spices. The beach still retains old pier pillars that once supported cargo transfer to ships offshore. Over time, the area developed into a central recreational spot with a promenade, children's park, food stalls, and a lighthouse nearby. Today, it is one of the most visited places in Kozhikode city for both locals and tourists, especially in the evenings.

significance.tourism: Primary beach attraction in Kozhikode city, known for sunsets and street food.
significance.heritage: Symbol of Kozhikode's maritime and trade history.
significance.culture: A favourite gathering place for local families, students, and visitors.

timings.note: Most crowded during evenings and weekends.

activities: Photography near the old pier remains
Enjoying local snacks from beach stalls

warnings: Swimming is not strongly encouraged due to waves and currents.
Avoid going too close to the edge of the old pier remains.
Littering is discouraged; use dustbins provided.

best_time_to_visit: October to February for pleasant weather
Evenings between 5 PM – 7 PM for sunset
visitor_info.average_crowd_level: High during evenings, moderate on weekdays

common_complaints: Parking can be difficult on weekends
tips_from_visitors: Visit around sunset for the best experience.
Try local favourites like ice creams, banana chips, and kallummakaya (mussels).
If driving, arrive a bit early to secure parking.

nearest_airport.name: Calicut International Airport (Karipur)
travel_options: Bus from airport region to Kozhikode city, then auto

by_road.description: Frequent buses to Kozhikode city from nearby districts; from bus stand, autos and city buses connect to the beach.
by_road.parking_info: Limited roadside parking along Beach Road and near Lions Park; busy on weekends.

local_transport_tips: Autos are the quickest way to reach from railway station or city center.
Evening traffic near the beach can be heavy; plan extra time.
The beach area is pedestrian-friendly for walking along the promenade.
